channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-8548] Nodetool Cleanup - java.lang.AssertionError
item.description:
Needed to free up some space on a node but getting the dump below when running nodetool cleanup.

Tried turning on debug to try to obtain additional details in the logs but nothing gets added to the logs when running cleanup. Added:

log4j.logger.org.apache.cassandra.db=DEBUG

in log4j-server.properties

See the stack trace below:

root@cassandra-019:~# nodetool cleanup

Error occurred during cleanup

Looks like the second dump is caused by this assertion:

https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/cassandra-2.0.11/src/java/org/apache/cassandra/db/ColumnFamilyStore.java#L2132

In which c* checks if the result of data.getCompacting().isEmpty() is true before continuing with the cleanup.

The user had a stuck compaction for over a day, so he tried forcing a compaction and ran into this error.
andrew.tolbert What version of c*? So far we've seen this in 2.0.11
Woops, forgot to include that. It was 2.0.11, sebastian.estevez@datastax.com.
This looks like it is also from 2.0, performAllSSTableOperation was removed in 2.1?

attaching patch that makes sure we unmark compacting sstables on error

I think the stack trace in the initial description was due to a corrupt sstable (should scrub after seeing something like that), the subsequent ones are due to cassandra not releasing the sstables after that exception.

This should not be an issue in 2.1, it might be something else there (CASSANDRA-8537 perhaps)
Thanks Marcus for looking into this. You are right, the stack trace above is from 2.0.11 not 2.1.x.

The following procedure gets the sstable back in order (thanks Marcus):

1) Restart the node, this will release the SSTable which was not released probably due to the SSTable corruption.

2) run nodetool scrub on the culprit sstables on that node to fix the corruption.

3) Run cleanup.

What's the right procedure to restart the node? ( I ran disablebinary, disablethrift, disablegossip, setcompactionthroughput 0 and then enabled everything back).
Tried running scrub after that and I still get the same error.
